headline.main: Russians Push Nazis Back Farther In a Growing Counter-Offensive; Moscow Sees Germans Failing to Sustain Huge Line Under Punishing Attacks -- Berlin Claims 45,000 Prisoners

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 1 -- After seventeen days of the second major German offensive, concentrated in the key Smolensk area and supported by subsidiary drives in the Ukraine and Leningrad directions, it is now clear, according to official information here, that Russian counter-attacks not only are enabling the Red Army to hold its positions all along the 1,800-mile front, but are forcing back the Wehrmacht considerable distances at several points and annihilating invading units at others.
abstract: USSR Army pushes back Germans in counter-attacks, Ukraine and Leningrad sectors; USSR claims Baltic and Black Seas control
